content:
To calculate the VAT (Value-Added Tax) of a shopping list in the Philippines, you will need to know the VAT rate, which is currently at 12%, and the total cost of the items on the list.

You can calculate the VAT by multiplying the total cost of the items by the VAT rate (in decimal form).

For example, if the total cost of the items on your shopping list is PHP 1000, the VAT would be:

1000 x 0.12 = PHP 120

So the total cost of the items including VAT would be:

1000 + 120 = PHP 1,120
